sections.heading: Who can get Survivor benefits
paragraphs: You may qualify if you’re the spouse, divorced spouse, child, or dependent parent of someone who worked and paid Social Security taxes before they died.

sections.heading: What you could get
paragraphs: You could get a monthly payment and may be eligible for Medicare based on the work history of the family member who died.

sections.heading: What to report if you get Survivor benefits
paragraphs: Once you’re approved for Survivor benefits, you must report changes to your work, income, and personal information.

sections.heading: When to report a death
paragraphs: A funeral home will usually tell us when someone dies, so you may not need to report a death to us.

sections.heading: Report changes to your personal information
Request to keep benefits when a child turns 18
paragraphs: If a child turns age 18 and is still in school (K–12), use the Advance Notice of Termination of Child's Benefits (Form SSA-1372) (PDF) to ask to keep their benefits.
